overview: In Journey to the Sea, an elderly woman floats down a river of elusive memories and fragmented artifacts from cinemaâ€˜s history, straining to recall the places that she has been. Passing through childhood creeks and riverside views of great cities, she also struggles to remember the impulse of travel itself. Her fading and fluid memories of touristic desire merge into an unreliable account of a great river teeming with duck-billed platypuses, disappearing Native Americans, fellow tourists and intimate hair washes.
title: Journey to the Sea
